member.name: T:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.GenericParameters
member.summary: Helper class, for easy REST query parameters string generation 1. Use GenericParameters.Serialize() to generate the query string 2. Use GenericParameters.ParametersCollection for adding query parameters 3. Inherit this class, to create usable parameters holders Add an attribute [HttpQueryMemberAttribute] on each property for serializing it automatically 4. Modify ConvertBooleansToInteger.GenericParameters to serialize bool and bool? as "0" and "1" Important: You have to add here all derived classes, that are serealized as json as a KnownType

member.name: T:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.GPSParameters
member.summary: Helper class, for setting GPS data Used to create the suitable query string See example in Route4MeExamples.SetGPSPosition()

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.HttpQueryMemberAttribute.Name
member.summary: The serialized argument name, if specifed overrides the property name

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.HttpQueryMemberAttribute.EmitDefaultValue
member.summary: Specifies whether to emit the property value, if its value is a default value

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.HttpQueryMemberAttribute.DefaultValue
member.summary: Specifies the default value, that is used when emiting the property value If not specified null is used as a default value

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.OrderParameters.limit
member.summary: Limit per page, if you use 0 you will get all records

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.OrderParameters.query
member.summary: if query is array search engine will search by fields, if query is string will search by all text fields. Array / string.

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.OrderParameters.fields
member.summary: Use it for get specific fields. String / coma separated

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.OrderParameters.scheduled_for_YYMMDD
member.summary: Date an order was scheduled for

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Directions
member.summary: Pass True to return directions and the route path

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.RoutePathOutput
member.summary: "None" - no path output. "Points" - points path output

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.DeviceTrackingHistory
member.summary: Output route tracking data in response

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Limit
member.summary: The number of existing routes that should be returned per response when looking at a list of all the routes.

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Offset
member.summary: The page number for route listing pagination. Increment the offset by the limit number to move to the next page.

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Original
member.summary: Output addresses and directions in the original optimization request sequence.

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Notes
member.summary: Output route and stop-specific notes. The notes will have timestamps, note types, and geospatial information if available

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.ReOptimize
member.summary: Updating a route supports the reoptimize=1 parameter, which reoptimizes only that route. Also supports the parameters from GET.

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.DisableOptimization
member.summary: For /api.v3/route/reoptimize_2.php endpoint. If equal to 0, optimization is enabled

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.RecomputeDirections
member.summary: By sending recompute_directions=1 we request that the route directions be recomputed (note that this does happen automatically if certain properties of the route are updated, such as stop sequence_no changes or round-tripness)

member.name: P:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.QueryTypes.RouteParametersQuery.Parameters
member.summary: Route Parameters to update. (After a PUT there is no guarantee that the route_destination_id values are preserved! It may create copies resulting in new destination IDs, especially when dealing with multiple depots.)

member.name: T:Route4MeSDKLibrary.Route4MeSDK.Route4MeManager
member.summary: This class encapsulates the Route4Me REST API 1. Create an instance of Route4MeManager with the api_key 1. Shortcut methods: Use shortcuts methods (for example Route4MeManager.GetOptimization()) to access the most popular functionality. See examples Route4MeExamples.GetOptimization(), Route4MeExamples.SingleDriverRoundTrip() 2. Generic methods: Use generic methods (for example Route4MeManager.GetJsonObjectFromAPI() or Route4MeManager.GetStringResponseFromAPI()) to access any availaible functionality. See examples Route4MeExamples.GenericExample(), Route4MeExamples.SingleDriverRoundTripGeneric()

member.summary: Create User Activity. Send custom message to Activity Stream.
